item.title: Identifying ReFi Revenue Models
item.description: Trinity Morphy enumerates the revenue models currently employed by ReFi projects and teases further research into funding readiness.
item.author: trinity@carboncopy.news (Trinity Morphy)

item.title: Exploring the Social Impact Side of ReFi with YOMA
item.description: Trinity Morphy takes a closer look at the Youth Agency Marketplace for Africans and its potential for social impact.
item.author: trinity@carboncopy.news (Trinity Morphy)

item.title: Optimising the Squad Staking Model to Fund the Regen Movement
item.description: Trinity Morphy proposes a modification to the current squad staking model that would unlock funding at scale for the regen movement.
item.author: trinity@carboncopy.news (Trinity Morphy)

item.title: Louise Borreani and Pat Rawson of Ecofrontiers - Part 2
item.description: The authors of The Green Crypto Handbook discuss the transition to onchain environmental finance, regulatory and narrative shifts, and the EU's recent nature credit announcement.
item.author: trinity@carboncopy.news (Trinity Morphy)

item.title: Louise Borreani and Pat Rawson of Ecofrontiers - Part 1
item.description: Trinity Morphy catches up with the authors of The Green Crypto Handbook to discuss ecocapitalism, the onchain environmental finance stack, and the maturity of blockchain.
item.author: trinity@carboncopy.news (Trinity Morphy)

item.title: Breaking Down the Octant Epoch 7 Climate Solutions Funding Round
item.description: Trinity Morphy provides his analysis of the recent round by Octant and Climate Coordination Network.
item.author: trinity@carboncopy.news (Trinity Morphy)

item.title: Collaborative Finance for Regen Collectives
item.description: Trinity Morphy dives into an unheralded approach to grassroots finance and lays out potential solutions for regen collectives.
item.author: trinitymorphy89@gmail.com (Trinity Morphy)

item.title: A Deep Dive into the Economics of ReFi X-to-Earn Projects
item.description: Trinity Morphy explores the X-to-Earn concept, its potential for financial and impact sustainability, and possible revenue models.
item.author: trinitymorphy89@gmail.com (Trinity Morphy)

item.title: ReFi's Unholy Trinity
item.description: Trinity Morphy explains why ReFi projects struggle, and what they can do about it.
item.author: trinitymorphy89@gmail.com (Trinity Morphy)

item.title: Decentralising the Planetâ€™s Powerhouse: The Promises of Blockchain-based Solar Production
item.description: Louise Borreani and Pat Rawson of Ecofrontiers explore Energy DePIN's potential to advance solar markets with a deep dive into Glow, the protocol driving solar energy expansion.
item.author: hello@carboncopy.news (Louise Borreani, Pat Rawson)

item.title: The One Thing Holding ReFi Back in Latin America
item.description: Tereza Bizkova questions why ReFi hasn't been more successful in the region despite a clear need for ecological and social regeneration.
item.author: hello@carboncopy.news (Tereza Bizkova)

item.title: Reviewing Regenaissance: The Call to Heal by Sharon Gal-or and Daniel Mihai
item.description: Trinity Morphy provides his thoughts on the recently published book about transforming the current economic and social systems by first transforming ourselves.
item.author: trinitymorphy89@gmail.com (Trinity Morphy)

item.title: Examining the Potential of Prediction Markets as a Funding Source for Impact
item.description: Trinity Morphy explores one of the hottest trends in Web3 and how it might be used to help solve the biggest problem in ReFi.
item.author: trinitymorphy89@gmail.com (Trinity Morphy)

item.title: Onboarding Impact Enthusiasts with the ReFi Club
item.description: Trinity Morphy introduces an initiative to bring a new segment of impact worker into the ReFi realm.
item.author: trinitymorphy89@gmail.com (Trinity Morphy)

item.title: Hypothesising a retail investment instrument with public goods funding integration
item.description: Trinity Morphy lays out his idea for a solution to the funding shortfall for ecological and social impact projects relying on public goods funding.
item.author: trinitymorphy89@gmail.com (Trinity Morphy)

item.title: What the Lagos State Plastic Ban Tells Us About Waste in Nigeria
item.description: Trinity Morphy questions the effectiveness of the ban and proposes some socioeconomic alternatives.
item.author: trinitymorphy89@gmail.com (Trinity Morphy)

item.title: Opening the Lid on VeChain's VeBetterDAO
item.description: Trinity Morphy explains the rise of ReFi in the VeChain ecosystem, what makes it so attractive, and what challenges lay ahead.
item.author: trinitymorphy89@gmail.com (Trinity Morphy)

item.title: Kennedy Ng'ang'a of Shamba Network - Part Two
item.description: The Shamba Network founder talks dMRV, Web3 and climate impact, ReFi, and the ReFi Kenya event.
item.author: hello@carboncopy.news (CARBON Copy Team)

item.title: Kennedy Ng'ang'a of Shamba Network - Part One
item.description: The CARBON Copy team recently spoke with Kennedy Ng'ang'a, founder of ecological data platform Shamba Network. In this two-part interview, Kennedy sheds light on anticipatory cash transfers, dMRV, and his thoughts on the state of ReFi in Kenya and beyond.
item.author: hello@carboncopy.news (CARBON Copy Team)

item.title: Can ReFi Help Prevent Future Writer Strikes?
item.description: As the Writers Guild of America (WGA) continues its labour dispute with the Alliance of Motion Picture and Television Producers (AMPTP), Regenerative finance (ReFi) and its underlying philosophy provides clues as to how we might prevent future disputes from interrupting our beloved pastime.
item.author: hello@carboncopy.news (CARBON Copy Team)

item.title: Sebastian Persch of Forest Carbon
item.description: The CARBON Copy team had a chance to sit down with Sebastian Persch, a forest scientist for reforestation project developer Forest Carbon, to discuss Web3's potential in the carbon credit space, the phenomenon of carbon tunnel vision, and what his future outlook is for regenerative finance.
item.author: hello@carboncopy.news (CARBON Copy Team)
